discussion.content: AC - Fortigate Infrastructure 6.2 Guide page 343
so philosophical of you.
A & C see sec 6.2 p.343

it is A and C 

"A Web browser implementing this method sends the DHCP server a DHCPINFORM query, the DHCP server will return the expected IP settings along with the 252 option which defines the location of the PAC file. The browser will then download this PAC file from the URL provided."

the dhcp does not provide the PAC file, but the url of the pac file. therefore D is not correct
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/web_security/connector/connector3000/WPADAP.html#wp1015113

A & C 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/web_security/connector/connector3000/WPADAP.html#wp1015113
A & C. DHCP does not provide the PAC file. As for the "ONFORM" although it is wrong it is likely a typo
Technically speaking the DHCP server doesn't provide the PAC file itself, but the URL to download it, so I would be inclined to say that A & C are correct.
Correct: A&D

A & D
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD40955
DHCPONFORM not exist. DHCPINFORM is true

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true when using WPAD with the DHCP discovery method? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The DHCP server provides the PAC file for download.
choices.C: The browser sends a DHCPONFORM request to the DHCP server.
choices.B: The browser needs to be preconfigured with the DHCP server's IP address.
choices.A: If the DHCP method fails, browsers will try the DNS method.

discussion.content: A and D
AD is correct, only 6 active route in the table *>

choices.D: The port1 and port2 default routes are active in the routing table.
choices.A: The port3 default route has the highest distance.
choices.B: The port3 default route has the lowest metric.
choices.C: There will be eight routes active in the routing table.

questions.question_text: If traffic matches a DLP filter with the action set to Quarantine IP Address, what action does FortiGate take?

discussion.content: https://help.fortinet.com/fortiproxy/10/Content/Admin%20Guides/FPX-AdminGuide/700_Security-Profiles/703_Data-leak-prevention.htm
C. The key is Quarantine where a expire time is expected.

choices.C: It blocks all future traffic for that IP address for a configured interval.
choices.B: It provides a DLP block replacement page with a link to download the file.
choices.A: It notifies the administrator by sending an email.
choices.D: It archives the data for that IP address.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is running the following sniffer command:
diagnose sniffer packet any "host 10.0.2.10" 3
What information will be included in the sniffer output? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: It really depends on the Verbosity Level. This specific question for Verbosity level 3 is ABC. Look on page 57 of the FortiGate Infrastructure Guide.
The correct answer is ACE
From my understanding Payload is not seen, so AB&E
ABC correct

comments.content: Sorry, I mean ABC (IP, Mac and payload)

discussion.content:
C is correct: 
Verbose levels in detail:
1: print header of packets
2: print header and data from IP of packets
3: print header and data from Ethernet of packets
4: print header of packets with interface name
5: print header and data from IP of packets with interface name
6: print header and data from Ethernet of packets with interface name 
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=11186

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about the FSSO collector agent timers is true?

discussion.content: The FortiGate_Infrastructure_Study_Guide-Online (page 266). The correct answer is D.

D is correct: This timer defines the period after which the system will purge logon information if it cannot verify user status.
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD31876

choices.C: The user group cache expiry is used to age out the monitored groups.
choices.D: The dead entry timeout interval is used to age out entries with an unverified status.
choices.B: The IP address change verify interval monitors the server IP address where the collector agent is installed, and the updates the collector agent configuration if it changes.
choices.A: The workstation verify interval is used to periodically check of a workstation is still a domain member.
